use of adjectives an adverbs

adjectives versus adverbs

This list was compiled by Colleen. The examples are found in the The Keeper of the Virgins by Hanann Al Shaykh

  • Short / shortly
  • Confident / confidently
    • He walked confidently to school
  • Thorough / thoroughly
    • (could also mean complete)
    • Have you gone over this paper thorougly enough
    • he studied thoroughly
  • Uneven / unevenly
    • they build the road unevenly
  • entire / entirely
    • He makes his work entirely (by himself)
    • not in the meaning of complete
  • gradual / gradually
    • page 10 2 paragraph
  • resolute / resolutely
    • determined
  • regular / regularly
  • hurried / hurriedly
  • Loud / loudly
  • disbelieving / disbelievingly
  • extreme / extremely
  • bashful / bashfully (shy)
  • awkward / awkwardly
  • humble / humblely
  • immense / immensely
    • (big)
  • sorrowful / sorrowfully
    • (sad)
  • wholehearted / wholeheartedly
  • firm / firmly
  • he knocked on the door firmly
  • unpredictable / unpredictably
  • expectant / expectantly
  • gentle / gently

list adjectives

Adjectives from Nicola Barker’s short story: G-String

  • Pudgy
  • Reliable
  • flourishing
  • ardent
  • skinny
  • elegant
  • sparky
    • sparks from the fire
  • intelligent
  • safe
  • cruel
  • simple-minded
    • (background: in the meaning of simple minded family)
  • glorious
    • grandious
  • expensive
    • costly
  • visible
  • thin
  • sophisticated
    • technology or person
  • practical
    • how to cope
  • horrid
    • awful
  • preposterous
    • absurd
  • proper
  • silly
  • affected
    • not natural
  • old-fashioned
  • superior
    • better (a superior type of ice cream)
  • rhytmical
  • victorious
  • modern
  • dour-faced
